target: They are invertebrates. They are both in the main class of the phylum Arthropoda so they are both arthropods which have an exoskeleton.
context: <system> I am allergic to shellfish which are oddly not even a type of fish.  <user> they aren't. Then what the heck are they?  <system> Many types of shellfish are actually crustaceans which are closer to insects. There are other types as well.  <user> Insects you say? oh my. I wonder if a bug tastes as good as a lobster.  <system> They might taste similar since they are closely related, common ones that are eaten are shrimp, lobsters, crabs and crayfish. Crayfish remind me of insects a lot.  <user> Maybe I should try that. What else do they have in common with insects? <system>
